TopicTitle: Sometimes I spend hours and hours on bug reports (KSP1). That's all going to be a waste of time if someone else has already sent feedback to Intercept Games (KSP2). Please give us a bug tracker. Please?

Articles.Content:
The amount of time I spent on bug reports on KSP1 was from a few hours to a few months (for the more interesting ones).

But I knew if a bug had already been reported I would just interact with that posted bug report and not make a new one.

The feedback system on the PDLauncher and the Intercept Games discord just isn't the place for serious bug monitoring for us the public to interact with.

Not reporting bugs that have already been reported is a bad thing.  You want everyone to report all bugs so the devs understand what is happening.

However, what I'd like to see is a list of what bugs they are working on for the current release so I don't report something they are already fixing.

I'd second this.  Or maybe have a dedicated 'bug' sub that does not allow whining about performance and optimization or 'my mom's 2015 Lenovo won't run KSP2'.

 

True bugs are things like vehicles falling through the ground, parts not working correctly or incorrect text.

33 minutes ago, TechDragon said:

There's quite a bit of stuff I'm seeing that could be merged, is there a good way for us to politely nudge for merging in the bug sub-forum if as just a forum reader/participant and not the original authors or a forum mod, come across stuff that has described the same problem in different ways? 

No, in this case there isn’t a good way to do this.    
 

The “best” way to do this is to report the thread, and in the description give us a link to where it should go.    The report button on each post (found under the “…” in the upper right of each post) acts as a bug/ticket tracker on its on.   It allows the moderators to track issues on the forum.  For Pete’s sake, please don’t mistake the report button for the game bug tracker.           The downside of this is that it creates a fairly large burden of housekeeping work for the moderator staff.    But this is the only real option so…..

Posting in the thread itself and pinging the moderators will do the job, but only if you ping the moderators that are actually online.   And then after the merge, that post looks ugly and adds confusion, since the link is now self referential.   And if you only post the link, the mods will never see it, as we’re rarely trolling though individual tech support / bug threads.  
 

And please don’t pm us to move/merge.   If you can take the time to PM, you can report.   It’s nearly identical.    Due to the number of PM’s I’ve been getting from this, I’ve been merely reply “please report the thread”.    If the person you PM’d just went on vacation for three weeks, nobody will ever see that pm.  
 

So, until further notice (like PD implementing a public facing bug tracker) the best option is to report the post, all the mods online see that and will get to it when they can.
